subject: Re: class isolation and class order for testing
msgSnippet: ... for an ... tests are run? ... they are completely independent from one another. First of all, thanks for your tips! As my second question is concerned: I
messageBody:
> > 2)
> > Is there any strategy/method in what order you can test classes
for an
> > existing project?

> Do you mean the order in which you write the tests, or in which the
tests are run?

> I write a test just before I write the code to make it pass.

> I don't assume that they run in any particular order, and so ensure
they are completely independent from one another.

First of all, thanks for your tips!

As my second question is concerned: I did not mean the order of
writing the tests nor the order of running the tests (this is the
responsibility of JUnit framework).

I meant the following:
I cannot do a TDD this time, because I have already an existing
project with about 100 production classes (and some time to learn and
exercise JUnit tests).
So which class shall I start with to write JUnit tests for? Perhaps
it is worth starting with a class that does not have any collaborators
or only ones that are already tested in a previous "test phase".

Thanks,
Csaba
